title: French Endive With Celery Mayonnaise, Artificial Crab Meat, And
summary: French Endive With Celery Mayonnaise, Artificial Crab Meat, And is a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian recipe with 1 servings. This main course has 488 calories, 18g of protein, and 32g of fat per serving. For $2.68 per serving, this recipe covers 23% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. If you have belgian endive, celery, raisins, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the raisins you could follow this main course with the Rice Pudding with Raisins and Cinnamon as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. This recipe is typical of Mediterranean cuisine. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 61%. This score is pretty good. Similar recipes are Celery Endive Slaw, Endive And Celery Salad With Fennel Vinaigrette, and Creamy Braised Chicory/Belgian Endive and Celery With Peas.

winePairing.pairingText: French can be paired with Bordeaux, Champagne, and White Burgundy. French wine is just as diverse as French food, but you rarely go wrong with champagne. If your meal calls for a white wine, you might also try a white burgundy. For a red, try a red bordeaux blend. The Chateau Fleur Haut Gaussens Bordeaux Superieur with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 15 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Chateau Fleur Haut Gaussens Bordeaux Superieur
productMatches.description: Deep ruby robe, intense aromas of black berries, toast, spices and vanilla. Fresh and fruity in the mouth with velvety tannins and a nice finish.Blend: 85% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Malbec, 5% Petit Verdot
